request.description:
## Edit Permission

This endpoint allows you to modify the permissions associated with a specific role in the system. It is used to update the access rights for different tabs within the application.

### Request

- **Method:** POST
    
- **URL:** `{{base_url}}/permission/edit`
    
- **Content-Type:** application/json
    

#### Request Body

The request body must be a JSON object containing the following parameters:

- `data` (Array of Objects): An array of permission objects that define the access rights for different tabs. Each object in the array should include:
    
    - `_id` (String): The unique identifier for the permission entry.
        
    - `tabName` (String): The name of the tab for which permissions are being set.
        
    - `displayName` (String): The display name of the tab.
        
    - `tabUrl` (String): The URL associated with the tab.
        
    - `number` (Integer): An integer representing the order or priority of the tab.
        
    - `hasView` (Boolean): Indicates if the role has view permission for the tab.
        
    - `hasAdd` (Boolean): Indicates if the role has add permission for the tab.
        
    - `hasEdit` (Boolean): Indicates if the role has edit permission for the tab.
        
    - `hasDelete` (Boolean): Indicates if the role has delete permission for the tab.
        
    - `isActive` (Boolean): Indicates if the permission is currently active.
        
    - `parentId` (String or Null): The ID of the parent permission, if applicable.
        
    - `createdAt` (String): Timestamp of when the permission was created.
        
    - `updatedAt` (String): Timestamp of when the permission was last updated.
        
    - `__v` (Integer): Version key for the permission object.
        
    - `view` (Boolean): Indicates if the view permission is enabled.
        
    - `add` (Boolean): Indicates if the add permission is enabled.
        
    - `edit` (Boolean): Indicates if the edit permission is enabled.
        
    - `delete` (Boolean): Indicates if the delete permission is enabled.
        
- `roleId` (String): The unique identifier of the role whose permissions are being edited.
    

### Response

The response will typically include a confirmation of the update status, along with any relevant data regarding the updated permissions. The structure may vary depending on the implementation, but it generally indicates whether the operation was successful or if there were any errors.

Ensure that the input parameters are correctly formatted and that the role ID corresponds to an existing role in the system to avoid errors during the update process.
